section: The Joint Venturers may be required to make capital contributions to the Joint Venture as needed.
explanation: The phrase "as needed" is vague and does not provide a clear definition of when and how capital contributions will be determined. This could lead to disputes between the Joint Venturers regarding the amount and timing of such contributions.

section: Distributions may only be made if after any distribution is made, the Joint Venture assets are in excess of all liabilities of the Joint Venture.
explanation: While this clause aims to protect the solvency of the Joint Venture, it lacks specific details on how assets and liabilities are to be valued. The absence of valuation methods can lead to disagreements and potential disputes regarding the permissibility of distributions.

section: Further, each Party elects under the authority of Section 761(a) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (the "Code"), as amended and all successor statutes, to be excluded from the application of all of the provisions of Subchapter K of Chapter 1 of the Subtitle A of the Code, and the Parties agree that the election out of Subchapter K of Chapter 1 of Subtitle A of the Code shall, if necessary, be manifested by their execution and filing of all appropriate documentation.
explanation: While the intention to elect out of Subchapter K is clear, the language "if necessary" creates ambiguity. It's unclear who determines whether filing documentation is necessary and what criteria are used to make that determination. This could lead to disagreements or a failure to properly execute the election, potentially causing unintended tax consequences.
